intro: Cercinia doumeri, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and milky sap. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory properties. The plant also has cultural significance in various regions of Africa.
